access.notes: Main certifications page has EHI section with links to per-product subpages. Each subpage has a single CLICK HERE download link. No accordion, no JavaScript required.

export_format.description: Varies by product. myAvatar, CarePathways, and TheraOffice export delimited files (one file per table). myEvolv and myUnity export JSON files packaged as ZIP. myHealthPointe uses relied-upon software from another certified product and only documents a messages report.

documentation.notes: Six separate downloads for six products. myAvatar alone is 12.5 MB (ZIP) containing a 7,492-page PDF. myEvolv provides the richest developer documentation (XLSX data dictionary + companion guide DOCX + SQL queries).

clinical.evidence: All products: diagnosis tables, vitals, allergies, immunizations, medications, lab results, assessments, care plans, problems/needs lists

secure_messages.evidence: myHealthPointe documents a Subject Messages Report for portal messages between clients and providers (8 fields: To, From, Sent, Read, Priority, Message Content, Response, Response Date). myAvatar has pcp_communications and audit_pcp_communications tables. Other products: minimal/no explicit messaging tables found.

billing_financial.evidence: myAvatar: 100+ billing tables (billing_tx_charge_detail, billing_tx_charge_totals, billing_pay_adj_history, billing_837*, billing_835*, claim_follow_up, front_desk_payment_entry, unacknowledged_payments, Remittance_Batch_History). CarePathways: mv_fact_claim, mv_fact_claim_diagnosis, mv_fact_claim_service with charge/payment amounts. myUnity: Claims, ClaimCharges, ClaimChargeAdjustments files. TheraOffice: PTCASE table includes billing fields but limited.

insurance_coverage.evidence: myAvatar: 20+ insurance/eligibility tables (eligibility_demographics, eligibility_subscriber, billing_271_*, billing_834_*, service_auth_detail, history_member_auths). CarePathways: dim_client_insurancepolicy, dim_payor, dim_payorplan. myUnity: HealthInsurance, Eligibility, Authorization export files. TheraOffice: PAT_PROFILE includes INSURANCE1/2/3 fields.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: myAvatar: 27+ appointment/scheduling tables (AppointmentData, AppointmentSeries, waiting_room_*, site_specific_appt_scheduling, telehealth_appt). CarePathways: fact_appointment, fact_visit. myUnity: Appointments file. myEvolv: extensive event categories for activities and encounters.

documents_images.evidence: myAvatar: 23+ notes/document tables (cw_patient_notes, Progress_Note_Corrections, significant_finding_note). myUnity: Attachments and Documents export files. CarePathways: fact_assessmentdocument. TheraOffice: limited document coverage. Product pages note 'some electronic health information might not be available in a table format, such as rich text documents or images. This information is referenced in the extracts created for subsequent export.'

audit_trails.evidence: myAvatar: 45+ audit tables (audit_appointment_data, audit_deleted_appointment, audit_deleted_claims, audit_payment_acknowledge, audit_outreach_client, audit_pcp_communications, coding_chart_audit, risk_level_update_data_audit, task_definitions_audit). CarePathways: audit fields within fact tables (auditinformationcreatedbystaffmemberid). TheraOffice: CREATED_USER/CREATED_DATE/MODIFIED_USER/MODIFIED_DATE columns on tables.

developer_guide_notes: myEvolv provides a comprehensive companion guide (DOCX) with configuration steps, usage instructions, JSON interpretation examples, and SQL queries. Other products have overview/glossary sections in their PDFs but no standalone developer guide.

downloaded_files.contents: 3 files: companion guide (DOCX, 939 KB), data dictionary crosswalk (XLSX, 11.2 MB with 115K+ event-column rows + 21K non-event-column rows), SQL queries (6.5 KB)

issues: myHealthPointe uses 'relied upon software' for b(10) — its own documentation only covers secure messages (8 fields, 3 pages). This is effectively a stub.
myAvatar documentation is dated September 2023 — nearly 2 years old at time of collection.
TheraOffice has very limited scope: 19 tables, mostly USCDI-aligned. No billing, scheduling, or messaging tables. This suggests the export may be closer to USCDI/FHIR scope than true 'all EHI'.
CarePathways uses an EDW (Enterprise Data Warehouse) schema with star/snowflake dimension/fact tables rather than operational tables — the export may not reflect the full operational database.
Rich text documents and images are noted as 'not available in table format' but 'referenced in the extracts' — binary content handling is unclear.
myAvatar ZIP href was missing leading slash in HTML — potential link breakage in some contexts.
summary: Netsmart Technologies provides separate EHI export documentation for each of its 6+ certified products. Documentation quality and depth varies enormously: myAvatar has 445 tables across 7,492 pages with extensive billing/insurance/audit coverage; myEvolv provides the most developer-friendly package (XLSX crosswalk with 136K+ field mappings, companion guide, and SQL queries); myUnity documents 24 JSON export files with 366 fields; CarePathways covers 62 EDW tables; TheraOffice has 19 USCDI-aligned tables; and myHealthPointe is essentially a stub that delegates to other products. The exports use native formats (delimited files or JSON) rather than FHIR — this is genuine database-level EHI export. myAvatar's documentation stands out for its extraordinary depth in billing (100+ tables covering all X12 EDI transaction types) and audit trails (45+ audit tables).
